entries.meaning: A device (transducer) used to convert sound waves into a varying electric current; normally fed into an amplifier and either recorded or transmitted over radio.
examples: Behind the tangled garden of microphones that had sprouted on the lectern, Goldwater spoke softly and casually about his family.

verbs.description: microphone (third-person singular simple present microphones, present participle microphoning, simple past and past participle microphoned)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To put one or more microphones on or in.
